page.title: 13LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: HAREWOOD CASTLE THE CASTLE IS IN A DANGEROUS CONDITION,AND CANNOT BE VISITED.A GOOD VIEW OF THE REMAINS OF THE BATTLEMENTS CAN BE SEEN FROM THE A61.MUCH OF ITS EARLY HISTORY IS NOT KNOWN ALTHOUGH IT IS THOUGHT THAT THE BUILDING WAS COMMENCED DURING THE REIGN OF KING STEPHEN AND WAS IMPROVED ABOUT 1150 DURING THE REIGN OF EDWARD 1 BY WILLIAM DE CURCI.IT WAS BUILT IN THE FORM OF A RIGHT-ANGLED PARALLELOGRAM- ITS SIDES IN THE DIRECTION OF THE CARDINAL POINTS OF THE COMPASS.THE TWO SEPARATE TOWERS ON THE SE AND NE WERE OVER 100' HIGH AND COMMANDED A MOST EXTENSIVE VIEW OF THE WHOLE COUNTRYSIDE.THE OTHER TWO TOWERS WERE SMALLER.ONE TOWER WAS BLOWN DOWN IN THE GALES OF FEBRUARY 1962.
